data.title: disappointing
data.text: were hoping to be wowed with a retro sushi boat experience. sat in nice booth instead, ordered from menu. Fish in udon bowl not fresh. Nigiri sampler - lackluster. Pork teriyaki tough. disappointing on every front.

data.title: Great place for lunch!
data.text: Favorably priced lunch specials, with much variety and samplings served on a multi-divided tray.   I like the options of chicken teriyaki, salmon teriyaki, veggie & prawn tempura, salad, miso soup, and rice.   Alternate choices include beef teriyaki, sushi rolls, sashimi, and a lightly fried veggie cake (tasting much like fried mashed potatoes).   A feast and a delight for all taste buds.   I work close by and like to stop in here about once a week for lunch, and sometimes with a little Sake.   Large sushi bar in the center of the restaurant.  Nice private booths as well as tables.   Very accomodating servers.

data.title: Great spot when your with kids
data.text:
This is one of our favorite places to eat with our four year old. We find the food is good and enjoyable and the service is great. As we frequent there the staff know us and always get our table ready for us when we arrive. There is an area (counter) set aside that has many activities for kids to entertain themselves. (coloring, games, books. Fantastic idea)
They are very accommodating for our daughters eating needs and make sure she is well taken care of when we are there.
I find the prices to be very reasonable and whether you are with kids or not this is a great place to enjoy a meal. (Ramen especially yummy :)

data.title: Typical Japanese food. Nothing special
data.text: Slow service and an inspiring menu make for dependable and affordable dining but nothing special.  Large space could use. Makeover

data.title: Amazing price for the portions you get.
data.text:
Went there on 12th of December. Ordered a Teriyaki Chicken entree, which came with salad, rice, and miso soup in quite good portions, and it was only $10. 

Food was of great quality, and the prices were definitely right. The drinks were also quite big, which is a pleasant surprise as most Japanese/Asian restaurants I go to skimp on the size of the drinks and lack refills. 

If I'm ever around the town again I would gladly go back. Definitely recommended.

data.title: Thank you, Tenku
data.text: Tenku is right in the heart of downtown San Rafael..near the banks, the theatre, the billiard hall and lots of interesting shops.. The sushi bar is large and the service  relaxed and accomodating.  What I so appreciated was the green tea ice cream which I found one unusually warm day after I'd walked a mile! Lately I tried the spring rolls and was quite satisfied, but the ice cream is what endeared me to Tenku and it's funny waving good luck cat statues..  Check it out.
